intro: Lophalix bicolor, commonly known as the two-colored lophalix, is a member of the Apiaceae family, characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. It is native to parts of Asia and is often found in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, which are typical of the carrot family. Its leaves are often used in traditional medicine for their purported anti-inflammatory properties. Lophalix bicolor is also valued in horticulture for its ornamental appeal and ability to thrive in partially shaded conditions.
